item.title: python repl
item.description: Using repl to debug python. https://jvns.ca/blog/2021/09/16/debugging-in-a-repl-is-fun/ what’s a REPL? REPL stands for “read eval print loop”. A REPL is a program that: reads some input from you like print(f"2 + 2 = {2+2}") (read) evaluates the input (eval) print out the result (print) and then goes back to step 1 (loop) A couple years ago I used pry in ruby/chef a bunch and then I guess I forgot about it. Now this works for python too and it is WAY better than my print statement hell that I usually write.
